item.title: Former Blizzard CCO’s Bonfire Studios’ Game Is Called Arkheron
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/former-blizzard-ccos-bonfire-studios-game-is-called-arkheron/

The next game led by former Blizzard Chief Creative Officer (CCO) Rob Pardo has officially been revealed. Pardo’s Bonfire Studios has announced Arkheron, a team-based PvP game “set in a dark and foreboding world”.

According to the studio, Arkheron will feature familiar “ideas and concepts”, but the game is “about creating something entirely new”. That being a dynamic, fast-paced PvP gameplay experience.

“There’s a simple truth at the heart of our development philosophy,” Pardo said via release. “If we don’t love our game, our players won’t either. We believe the best games are born from a genuine love of playing them, which is why we’ve poured years of passion into developing Arkheron, constantly iterating and refining it to deliver something truly unique and exciting.

“We’ve played the game daily as a team for years, and while we haven’t figured out yet exactly how to describe it, we often say ‘you have to play it to get it’. We’re eager to start sharing the fun we’ve found in Arkheron with a wider community soon, and we hope players will love it as much as we do.”

The game has been holding private playtests and will be opening it up to more players in the coming months. Signups are currently open for those in North America with more regions opening later this year.

item.title: Falcons CS2 Roster Finds Victory in NiKo’s First Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/falcons-cs2-roster-finds-victory-in-nikos-first-game/

Nikola “NiKo” Kovač has finally played his first official match with Team Falcons, and the organization has to pleased with the first result of this new CS2 lineup. Despite a substantial financial backing, Falcons has struggled to break into the top of the Counter-Strike hierarchy in recent years, but the result today is a step in the right direction.

Before you jump below, consider trying your luck on Clash.gg – you could turn your unwanted skins into something much more valuable (18+ only)

NiKo and Former Heroic Trio Shine against ENCE at BLAST Bounty

Utilizing the BLAST event’s bounty system, the lower seeded ENCE opted to challenge Falcons. The ENCE core, led by four-time Major winner Lukas “gla1ve” Rossander, sought to take advantage of Falcons’ short time spent practicing together. ENCE gambled on a Train pick, hoping that Falcons would be even less prepared on the newest CS2 map.

Train was a highly entertaining affair, as the unfamiliar map produced a messy but fun match of Counter-Strike. But the big match experience of NiKo and the entirety of the Falcons roster prevailed over ENCE. ENCE came up short in several rounds where they had a man advantage, and was unable to hold onto a late 12-9 lead. It wasn’t NiKo who led the way for Falcons, but former Heroic member René “TeSeS” Madsen, who produced four multi-kill rounds in the final six rounds of regulation and overtime. Falcons claimed four straight rounds in OT to steal away Train, 16-12.

The series turned to Dust2, a strong map historically for several of Falcons’ individual players. Falcons started out strong with five straight T-side rounds, though ENCE managed to fight their way back. NiKo stepped up the most in Falcons’ second half CT-side, but the team couldn’t stop ENCE from sending the second map to OT as well. However, TeSeS delivered for Falcons in the clutch again in OT, closing out a close series win for Falcons.

item.title: PGA Tour 2K25 Courses Revealed: All 29 Courses Coming To The Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pga-tour-2k25-courses-revealed-all-29-courses/

2K Sports has revealed 26 of the 29 courses launching with PGA Tour 2K25 when it releases on February 28. This year’s game features 29 license courses at release with more to be added—The Old Course at St. Andrews being one of them—via post-launch updates.

Courses making their franchise debut include Oakmont Country Club and Royal Portrush Golf Club.

Making their debut in the PGA Tour 2K series are three major tournaments: The U.S Open, PGA Championship, and The Open Championship. The Masters currently remains exclusive to EA Sports PGA Tour. The tournaments will be a part of the game’s MyCareer along with events such as the Arnold Palmer Invitational, Tour Championship, AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am, and more.

If you don’t see a course you were hoping to play, there’s the possibility that it could come later on. There’s also the ability to create it yourself or download someone else’s design via the game’s course creator.

You can check out the list of courses below. The remaining three will be revealed at a later date.

PGA Tour 2K25 Courses

  • Atlantic Beach Country Club
  • The Bay Hill Club & Lodge
  • Copperhead Course
  • Detroit Golf Club
  • East Lake Golf Club
  • Oakmont Country Club (the 2025 U.S. Open)
  • Payne’s Valley
  • Pebble Beach
  • Pinehurst Resort & Country Club
  • Quail Hollow (the 2025 PGA Championship)
  • The Riviera Country Club
  • Royal Portrush Golf Club

  • TPC Boston
